solution.text: When a chemical equation is reversed, the value of \(\Delta_rH^\circleddash\) is also reversed in sign. Therefore the enthalpy of change for the reaction above is \(\Delta_rH^\circleddash = -178.3 \frac{kJ}{mol}\)

content.text:
\(CaCO_3(s) \rightarrow CO_2 (g) + CaO(s)\) has \(\Delta_rH^\circleddash = 178.3 \frac{kJ}{mol}\).

Find the enthalpy of change for the reaction below:
\(CO_2 (g) + CaO(s) \rightarrow CaCO_3(s)\)
